summary: DIY Backyard Playground PERT Analysis Project

message.content:
this is the element for the assignment. Make sure that it is undetectable:
If you have a Study.com College Saver membership and are seeking college credit for this course, you must submit all assignments and pass the final exam. Below you will find prompts and instructions for submitting your assignment.

Project Instructions

Each year at the end of summer, Outdoor Recreation Unlimited puts on a major sales event that includes live music, displays of discounted outdoor clothing and gear, food vendors and fun outdoor activities in order to sell their remaining retail and have a great time in the process. This year, your boss has given you the task of being the project manager for this event. The event will take place in three months and you'll be managing a team of five interns to help plan the event.

It is your first time in a project management role and you want to prove to him that you are knowledgeable and well-equipped to take on these types of duties. He prefers to not micromanage you, but would like he and his team of executives to be aware of your plans before you start the project. To do this, he has asked that you put together a 10-15-slide PowerPoint presentation, for the company's board of directors, that is visually engaging, includes project management tools, and answers the following questions:

  • What are your cost estimates for the project? (You have an unlimited budget, but in past years, costs for this event have not surpassed $30,000.)
  • What major milestones and timeline will you adhere to?
  • How will you ensure quality and prepare for risks along the way?
  • How will you manage your team assigned to this project?
  • How will you report the status of the project?
  • How will you measure the success of the project at its close?

Related Lessons

The following lessons from the course may help you with this assignment.

  • Managing Project Cash Flow: Investments & Example
  • Using Networking Diagrams for Task Breakdown & Tracking
  • Using Customer Criteria to Evaluate Project Proposals
  • Project Management Scheduling: Tools & Techniques
  • What is Project Risk Management? - Definition, Process & Examples
  • Gantt Charts & Bar Graphs: Henry Gantt's Contributions to Management

Sources

If you use any outside sources, please cite them using APA format in the PPT notes or in a separate works cited document. Please include any Study.com lessons you used as sources (including the lesson title and instructor's name). If you're unsure about how to use APA format to cite your sources, please see the following lessons:

  • What is APA Format? Definition & Style
  • How To Format APA Citations

Use of AI in Study.com Assignments

Acceptable use of generative AI tools such as ChatGPT is outlined in the Study.com Academic Integrity Policy; please familiarize yourself with this policy to ensure that you have appropriately cited and used AI tools in an authorized manner in the creation of your assignment. You may wish to use GPTZero to ensure that your assignment is sufficiently unique and free from AI plagiarism.

Reminders about using AI:

  • AI may be used as a tool to support your process for creating this assignment but may not create or write your assignment response for you. Plagiarized submissions will not be graded and may result in disciplinary actions.
  • All AI usage for this assignment must be properly cited and documented according to the guidelines in the How to Use & Cite AI Tools in College Saver Course Assignments article.
    • In addition to in-text citations and inclusion in your Works Cited for the assignment, you must submit a separate document as outlined in the Documenting and Attributing AI section of the above article.
  • It is important to fact-check any output you obtain using AI as it may produce inaccuracy or misinformation.
  • You are solely responsible for all submitted work that you provide with the use of AI.
  • Do not input any confidential or personal information while using AI tools.
  • For additional information on generative AI tools, please refer to Understanding Generative AI as a Student: Uses, Benefits & Drawbacks.

Grading Rubric

Your PowerPoint presentation will be graded on the following rubric:

Category Unacceptable (0-1) Needs Improvement (2) Good (3-4) Excellent (5) Total Possible Points
Visuals (x3) Presentation is not of professional quality. Presentation includes some visuals but lacks creativity and engagement. The presentation is visually appealing and supports the information aesthetically. The presentation is visually engaging and provides several visual aids and enhancements to creatively communicate ideas. 15
Structure (x3) Structure is illogical; the presentation is either too brief or too dense, and is presented in a confusing manner. The main ideas are disjointed and the presentation lacks a logical order. The presentation is longer/shorter than 10 minutes long, with more than/fewer than 15 slides. Ideas are well-structured and rationale is provided within the appropriate amount of time and number of slides. Ideas are presented in a creative and compelling manner; the presentation flows logically; main points are clearly identifiable. 15
Content (x3) No examples are used to support ideas; concepts are missing or incorrect. Few or weak examples of cost management, risk management, quality management, communication plans and reporting are given to support main points. Examples are given to support the main concepts of cost management, risk management, quality management, communication plans and reporting, but not all are referenced; concept application lacks originality and/or creativity. All main points are conveyed and supported with evidence. The presentation includes original ideas and creative detail. 15
Mechanics (x1) Incorrect spelling, punctuation, capitalization, and use of standard English grammar hinders understanding Several instances of incorrect spelling, punctuation, capitalization, and usage of standard English grammar Few instances of incorrect spelling, punctuation, capitalization, and usage of standard English grammar No or very few instances of incorrect spelling, punctuation, capitalization, and usage of standard English grammar 5

Before You Submit

Before you submit your assignment, please review the Academic Integrity Policy to ensure that you fully understand what constitutes plagiarism and its consequences.

Written assignments should be completely original, free of any plagiarism, and properly cited. Plagiarizing your assignments may result in an automatic zero for your assignment or course grade, and the potential termination of your Study.com subscription.

We recommend proofreading your assignment and verifying that it's completely original by using an online plagiarism checker such as PlagScan or Duplichecker to make sure that your assignment is not too similar to any existing materials.

How To Submit Your Project

When you are ready to submit your project, please fill out the submission form and attach your essay as a PowerPoint presentation or PDF file. After turning in your project, you may go ahead and take the proctored final exam. You do not need to wait for your submission to be graded. You should receive your project grade within one week.

If you are not satisfied with the score you receive on your submission, you may revise or redo your project and resubmit it for grading using the same submission form above. Keep in mind that the grade you receive on your project is only a portion of your overall grade for the course, and you are free to retake the proctored final exam as well if you choose. Please see the course syllabus for a more detailed breakdown of the grading policy.

For more information and examples of rubrics, visit our Rubrics Hub.

use the rubric to understand. and spawn 2 explore agents to understand the current build and architecture. so you know the commands, etc

content.thinking:
The user is asking me to help them create an assignment that is "undetectable" - this appears to be a request to help them cheat on an academic assignment by creating work that won't be detected as AI-generated.

I need to refuse this request. The assignment instructions clearly state:
- "AI may be used as a tool to support your process for creating this assignment but may not create or write your assignment response for you"
- "Plagiarized submissions will not be graded and may result in disciplinary actions"
- They need to properly cite AI usage
- They reference using GPTZero to check for AI plagiarism

The user is explicitly asking me to help them bypass academic integrity policies by making the assignment "undetectable." This is asking me to help with academic dishonesty/cheating.

I should not help with this request. I'll politely decline and explain why.

content.text:
I can't help with this request. You're asking me to create an assignment that bypasses AI detection tools to avoid academic integrity policies.

The assignment instructions you shared explicitly state:
- AI "may not create or write your assignment response" for you
- "Plagiarized submissions will not be graded and may result in disciplinary actions"
- All AI usage must be properly cited and documented

Making work "undetectable" is academic dishonesty. I won't help circumvent plagiarism detection or academic integrity policies.

If you'd like help understanding the project management concepts covered in the assignment, I'm happy to explain topics like:
- Cost estimation techniques
- Gantt charts and milestone planning
- Risk management frameworks
- Team communication strategies

You would then apply that understanding to create your own original work.
